SEARCH
Package edu.ntnu.idi.idatt.services

Class MealSuggestionsService

java.lang.Object
edu.ntnu.idi.idatt.services.MealSuggestionsService
public class MealSuggestionsService extends Object
A service class allowing for a user interface, like TextUserInterface, to interact with a FoodStorage and Cookbook object.

Provides the following functionality:

  • Suggesting meals based on groceries expiring before a date
  • Suggesting meals based on groceries in the food storage
  • Suggesting a random meal, based on groceries in the food storage
Since:
1.0
Author:
WilliamHoltsdalen

    • caseSuggestMealsFromExpiringGroceries

      public void caseSuggestMealsFromExpiringGroceries()
      Suggests meals based on groceries that expire before a given date.

      The method prompts the user to enter a date, and then suggests meals based on recipes that can be made with groceries that expire before the given date. The method then prints the suggested meals to the console. If no groceries expire before the given date, the method prints a message indicating that no meals can be suggested.

    • caseSuggestMealsFromExistingGroceries

      public void caseSuggestMealsFromExistingGroceries()
      Suggests meals based on existing groceries in the food storage.

      The method calls the findPossibleRecipes method to find recipes that can be made with existing groceries in the food storage. If there are recipes that can be made with existing groceries, the method prints the meal suggestions.If there are no recipes that can be made with existing groceries, the method prints a message indicating that no meals can be suggested.

    • caseSuggestRandomMeal

      public void caseSuggestRandomMeal()
      Suggests a random meal based on existing groceries in the food storage.

      The method calls the findPossibleRecipes method to find recipes that can be made with existing groceries in the food storage. If there are recipes that can be made with existing groceries, the method randomly selects one of the recipes and prints the meal suggestion. If there are no recipes that can be made with existing groceries, the method prints a message indicating that no meals can be suggested.

    • findPossibleRecipes

      private Map<Recipe,List<Grocery>> findPossibleRecipes(List<Grocery> groceriesList)
      Finds possible recipes that can be made with the provided groceries.

      The method takes a list of groceries and returns a map of recipes to groceries. The map contains recipes that can be made with the provided groceries, and the groceries that can be used to make the recipe. The method also checks if the ingredients of the recipe are available in the groceries list. If an ingredient is not available, the method skips the recipe.

      Parameters:
      groceriesList - the list of groceries to find recipes for
      Returns:
      a map of recipes to groceries, or an empty map if no recipes can be made with the provided groceries, or if the provided groceries list is empty.
